summary: Language is how we communicate, using words, signs, or writing. It's unique to humans and has many forms, with estimates of 5,000 to 7,000 languages worldwide. Languages evolve and vary across cultures and time. They have rules for grammar and creating new sentences. We learn language as kids, and it's linked to our brain's ability to understand others' thoughts. Language is crucial for society, helping us express our identity, culture, and thoughts.
title: Language
